projects.title: Our Projects
projects.subtitle: Discover our latest initiatives and activities

1.title: Volunteering teams as a tool to support Inclusion training
1.description: Participated in the 'Volunteering teams as a tool to support Inclusion' training organized by SALTO in Prague, Czech Republic between October 20-24. During the training, studies were carried out on the contribution of volunteering teams to social inclusion, dissemination of inclusive approaches and good practice examples.

2.title: Unity in Diversity: Multicultural Sensitivity and Harmony for Disadvantaged Groups
2.description: The Unity in Diversity: Multicultural Sensitivity and Harmony for Disadvantaged Groups project is designed to support the social cohesion of disadvantaged young people from different cultures. The project aims to raise awareness on intercultural dialogue, social inclusion and respect for diversity.

3.title: PSYCHOCAMP
3.description: Erasmus+ KA210-YOU PSYCHOCAMP project is a small-scale partnership project aiming to increase the psychological resilience of young people and raise awareness about mental health. Within the scope of the project, trainings and workshops on psychological support mechanisms for young people, stress management, emotional intelligence and self-care will be organized.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our mission is to support individuals to overcome physical, social, economic or cultural barriers that restrict their participation in society. We promote equal opportunities, lifelong learning and social awareness through our projects. We aim for a society where everyone can make a meaningful contribution to a fair and inclusive future by supporting the development of each individual in line with their interests and competencies.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: As Engelleri A≈ûIN Association, we do not limit the concept of disability only to physical limitations; we evaluate every situation that prevents individuals from realizing their potential, such as language inadequacy, economic difficulties and social exclusion, within this scope. Our vision is to create an inclusive society where every individual ‚Äîespecially disabled individuals‚Äî can participate fully and actively in social life. While empowering young people personally and professionally, we aim for them to adopt the values of volunteering, empathy and solidarity.

1.name: Volunteering teams as a tool to support Inclusion training / European Shapers Alliance for Tomorrow
1.description: A full week raising awareness on active citizenship, leadership and European values has been completed! This project, funded by the Turkish National Agency and carried out within the scope of the Erasmus+ program, aimed to bring together young people from different European countries to strengthen intercultural dialogue and a common future vision.

2.description: The second workshop of the 'Bridge to the Future' Project organized specifically for NEET (not in education, employment or training) youth aged 18-30 is taking place in Istanbul! Covered Expenses: Accommodation, Food - Beverage, Travel Expenses. We are waiting for all young people who want to improve themselves to this special program!

3.name: Puppet Theater in Educational Work with Youth and Children
3.description: Erasmus+ training course aiming to support emotional, social and cognitive development of children and young people through creative drama and art-based learning. Project Aim: To introduce puppet theater as a creative and educational method.
3.details: Target Group: Youth workers, trainers, teachers or volunteers working with children and young people.

4.name: Unity in Diversity: Multicultural Sensitivity and Harmony for Disadvantaged Groups
4.description: It is an international initiative aimed at strengthening social awareness, empathy and sense of responsibility among young people. Participating young people will develop solution proposals against hate speech and prejudices.
4.details: Partners: Jordan, Bulgaria, Turkey, Romania, Belgium. Number of Participants: Total: 25 youth (13 male, 12 female). Application: 124.

5.name: PSYCHOCAMP (Inclusive, Restorative, Protective Family Motivation Program for Individuals with Psycho-Social Needs)
5.description: It is an Erasmus+ Youth Project carried out under the coordination of Engelleri A≈üan Association, in partnership with Spain, Poland and Turkey. Aim: To strengthen supportive approaches for people who care for individuals with psycho-social needs.
5.details: Project No: 2024-3-TR01-KA210-YOU-000285989. Partners: Spain, Poland, Turkey. Number of Participants: Total: 20 youth.
5.beneficiaries: Caregivers of Individuals with Psycho-Social Needs

6.name: DiscoverEU: Youth Removing Borders
6.description: Routes for Visually Impaired, Earthquake Victims, Hearing Impaired and mixed disability groups. Route 1: 16/09/2024 ‚Äì 26/09/2024 (North Macedonia, Serbia, Turkey). Route 2: 10/07/2025 ‚Äì 20/07/2025 (Spain, Portugal).
6.details: Routes and Number of Participants are available in the file.

7.name: BRIDGE: Building Resources for Inclusive Development, Guidance and Engagement for Disabled People
7.description: Project applied within the scope of Youth Workers Mobility in the 1st application period of 2025.

1.title: What is Domestic Violence?
1.excerpt: Physical, sexual, psychological and economic violence acts occurring between current or former members of the family or individuals living together.
1.content:
WHAT IS DOMESTIC VIOLENCE?
Physical, sexual, psychological, economic violence acts occurring between current or former members of the family or individuals living together.

TYPES OF VIOLENCE:
Physical Violence: Intentional acts causing pain or injury to the exposed person.
Sexual Violence: Forcing the person to any sexual act without consent.
Psychological Violence: Intentional attempts to force or disrupt the person's psychological integrity with threats.
Economic Violence: Preventing the person from earning or using economic resources such as money.

REMEMBER:
Threatening, depriving of basic needs such as nutrition, sleep, marrying children, forcing abortion, forced virginity control, humiliating, mocking, interfering with the person's clothing, behavior, communication with others, calling to account, manipulating is also violence.

YOU CAN'T SAY 'STOP' BECAUSE...
You may have thoughts such as fear of seeing more violence, lack of information about help sources, feeling helpless, economic or emotional dependence on the person showing violence, need to keep the family together, lack of self-confidence, fear of society.

WHERE CAN YOU APPLY?
You can report anonymously when you witness violence:
- Police and gendarmerie
- Alo 183
- 112 EMERGENCY
- Provincial Directorate of Family and Social Services
- SONIM (Violence Prevention and Monitoring Center)
- Bar Association
- Women's Non-Governmental Organizations
1.author: Ender Psychology

2.title: Fairytale Therapy
2.excerpt: Fairytale therapy is a form of therapy aimed at reaching the person's inner world, thoughts and feelings through fairytales.
2.content:
FAIRYTALE THERAPY
Fairytale therapy is a form of therapy aimed at reaching the person's inner world, thoughts and feelings through fairytales. Fairytale therapy, which is a kind of art therapy, works on the person identifying with the characters in the fairytales and gaining new perspectives on their own life story.

Fairytale therapy is frequently used by psychologists and counselors, especially working with children. However, this form of therapy can also help adults understand their life stories, experiences and problems. Fairytale therapy can contribute to the person understanding themselves and the events they experience better, solving emotional difficulties and personal development.

Fairytale therapy is a journey that gives people a new perspective on their life stories, problems and experiences. In this journey, we step into the magical world of fairytales and embark on adventures with heroes. In the world of fairytales, we find the chance to rewrite and make sense of our own story.

Fairytale therapy is a creative and fun form of therapy. In the colorful and vivid world of fairytales, we can rediscover our own story and give it a new meaning. Fairytale therapy can contribute to developing resilience against life's difficulties, protecting our emotional health and personal development.

Fairytale therapy is also a process of introspection and self-discovery. Through the events experienced and problems solved by fairytale characters, the person finds the opportunity to see the difficulties and solutions in their own life more clearly. The person who finds the opportunity to express and make sense of their own story with the symbolic language of fairytales becomes able to manage complex situations and emotional conflicts in their life better.

Fairytale therapy also encourages creativity and imagination. The colorful world of fairytales helps the person see their own story from a new and different perspective. In this process, the person recreates the characters, events and conflicts in their own life in the universe of fairytales and finds the opportunity to make emotional analyzes in this way.

The fairytales used in the therapy process can be selected according to the person's life experiences, emotional state and needs. Each fairytale can offer a different life lesson, solution or perspective. Therefore, fairytale therapy is a unique and flexible form of therapy.

As a result, fairytale therapy offers an effective way to make sense of the person's emotional world, express themselves and support the personal development process. Along with other art therapy forms such as bibliotherapy and cinematherapy, fairytale therapy can also be used as an effective tool in individual and group therapies.
2.author: Elif Nur Usta

content.mission: Our mission is to support individuals to overcome physical, social, economic or cultural barriers that restrict their participation in society. We promote equal opportunities, lifelong learning and social awareness through our projects.
content.activities: As Ender Association, we focus on social integration of disabled individuals, training of youth workers, intercultural dialogue and Erasmus+ projects. Also, as a Eurodesk contact point, we inform young people about European opportunities.
content.background: Our association was founded in Malatya in 2022 and has become one of the most active non-governmental organizations in the region in a short time.

eurodesk.heroDescription: As Malatya Eurodesk Contact Point, we bring youth together with European opportunities and provide free information and consultancy services.
eurodesk.aboutDescription1: Eurodesk is the European Youth Information Network providing information on European opportunities in education and youth fields and young people's participation in European activities.
eurodesk.aboutDescription2: Eurodesk Information Network, operating in 37 European countries, continues its activities within the body of the Turkish National Agency in our country.
eurodesk.aboutDescription3: As Ender Association, we serve as the authorized Eurodesk Contact Point in Malatya.
